FuncDef:
The timer hello command sets the interval for all PIM interfaces to send Hello messages.
The undo timer hello command restores the default value. The timer hello command sets the interval for all PIM interfaces to send Hello messages. The undo timer hello command restores the default value. By default, IPv6 PIM interfaces send Hello messages at an interval of 30 seconds. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
ParentView: IPv6 PIM view,VPN instance IPv6 PIM view

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the interval at which IPv6 PIM interfaces send Hello messages.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 18000, in seconds.
